snippet: The two high-ranking Navy intelligence officers were accused of personal misconduct in connection with government contracts.
abstract: Two high-ranking Navy intelligence officers, Vice Adm Ted Branch and Rear Adm Bruce Loveless, are stripped of their access to classified information after being implicated in a contracting scandal that federal prosecutors are investigating in San Diego; had been accused of personal misconduct in accepting gifts or services from Leonard Francis, a Malaysian contractor.

byline.original: By STEVE KENNY and CHRISTOPHER DREW

lead_paragraph: The two high-ranking Navy intelligence officers were accused of personal misconduct in connection with government contracts.

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject
